Colour.name: Curcumin
Colour.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

Colour.name: Riboflavin or lactoflavin (Vitamin B2)
description: Usually obtained from yeast or produced synthetically
Colour.examples: Added to processed cheese as yellow/orange colour

Colour.name: Quinoline Yellow
Colour.examples: Found in soft drinks, cakes, biscuits, puddings, meat products, sauces, tinned and packet convenience foods and confectionery

Colour.name: Quinoline Yellow
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, greenish yellow in colour
Colour.examples: Used with other yellow colours, especially in smoked fish

Colour.name: Sunset Yellow FCF, Orange Yellow S
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, yellow in colour, used with E102
Colour.examples: Found in soft drinks, cakes, biscuits, puddings, meat products, sauces, tinned and packet convenience foods and confectionery

Colour.name: Cochineal, Carminic acid, Carmines
description: Natural red colour obtained from egg yolk and dried insects
Colour.examples: Red colour in foods

Colour.name: Azorubine, Carmoisine
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red/purple in colour
Colour.examples: Often added to raspberry and chocolate flavoured desserts, marzipan, jam, cherryade, bottled sauce, and breaded products

Colour.name: Amaranth
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour
Colour.examples: Sometimes used in gravy mixes, meat patties, and blackcurrant drinks

Colour.name: Ponceau 4R, Cochineal Red A
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour
Colour.examples: added to strawberry jam, jelly and ice cream, tomato soup, savoury rice, cheesecake mix, and some meat products

Colour.name: Erythrosine
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour
Colour.examples: Regular component of glace cherries, peach melba yogurt, vacuum-packed ham and pork, tinned strawberries, and certain flavours of chips and potato-based snacks

Colour.name: Curcumin
Colour.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

Colour.name: Allura Red AC
Colour.examples: Used in drinks, baked goods, meat products, and sweets

Colour.name: Patent Blue V
Colour.examples: Used in some meat products

Colour.name: lndigotine, Indigo Carmine
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, blue in colour
Colour.examples: Added to gravy mix and certain meat products

Colour.name: Brilliant Blue FCF
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, blue in colour
Often mixed with E102 to make green
Colour.examples: Bacon flavoured snacks

Colour.name: Chlorophyll and chlorophyllins
description: Naturally occurring green pigment found plant leaves and stems
Colour.examples: Added to green vegetables to enhance their colour

Colour.name: Copper complexes of chlorophyll and chlorophyllins
description: A more stable colour obtained by a reaction between copper and manufactured chlorophyll
Colour.examples: Used to heighten the green colour of products such as cucumber relish

Colour.name: Green S
description: Commonly used brown colour and flavouring agent made from the caramelisation or burning of sugar by heat or chemicals
Colour.examples: Used in soft drinks, gravy mix, brown bread, cakes, biscuits, malt vinegar, marmalade, and beef products

Colour.name: Plain caramel
description: Commonly used brown colour and flavouring agent made from the caramelisation or burning of sugar by heat or chemicals
Colour.examples: Used in soft drinks, gravy mix, brown bread, cakes, biscuits, malt vinegar, marmalade, and beef products

Colour.name: Caustic sulphite caramel
description: With sulphite reactant, but no ammonium
Colour.examples: Used in tea, whiskey, and brandy

Colour.name: Ammonia caramel
description: With ammonium reactant, but no sulphite
Colour.examples: Used to colour soy sauce and beer

Colour.name: Sulphite ammonia caramel
description: With both sulphite and ammonia reactants
Colour.examples: Widely used for soft drinks

Colour.name: Brilliant Black BN, Black PN
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, black in colour
Colour.examples: Used to darken fruit sauces

Colour.name: Vegetable carbon
description: Natural black colour obtained from burnt plant material, now often manufactured
Colour.examples: Added to concentrated fruit juices, preserves, and jellies

Colour.name: Brown HT
description: A synthetic coal tar dye, brown in colour
Colour.examples: Various foods

Colour.name: Carotenoids
description: Plant pigments derived from carrots, tomatoes, apricots, oranges, rosehip and green leafy vegetables
Colour.examples: Provide a range of colours from yellow to red

Colour.name: Alpha-, beta, and gamma-carotenes
description: Beta-carotene is a well-known substance that is converted by the body to Vitamin A
Colour.examples: Added to biscuits, cakes, margarine, creamed rice, cheese products, and certain soups

Colour.name: Annatto
description: Orange/peach pigment naturally present in butter and cheese
Colour.examples: Used to give creamy colour to creamed rice, coffee creamer, pastry, cheese, and cheese products

Colour.name: Paprika extract, Capsanthian, Capsorubin
Colour.examples: Can be used to add colour and flavour to various food products

Colour.name: Lycopene
Colour.examples: May be used in processed foods, beverages, and ketchup

Colour.name: Beta-apo-8'-carotenal (C30) apocarotenal
Colour.examples: Sometimes used in processed cheese

Colour.name: Lutein
Colour.examples: Has been used as a chicken feed additive to promote yellow colouring of egg yolks

Colour.name: Canthaxanthin
Colour.examples: May be present in food and self-tanning products

Colour.name: Betanin (Beetroot Red)
description: Naturally occurring red/purple colour in beetroots
Colour.examples: May be added to oxtail soup

Colour.name: Anthocyanins
description: Plant pigments with colours ranging from red to blue
Naturally present in red cabbage and grapes
Colour.examples: Used in producing purple-colored beverages, confectionaries, and jams

Colour.name: Calcium carbonate (chalk)
Colour.examples: Frequently an ingredient in bread and baked products

Colour.name: Titanium dioxide
Colour.examples: Use no longer permitted in the EU and in Northern Ireland as of Feb 2022

Colour.name: Iron oxides and hydroxides
Colour.examples: Added to flour and breakfast cereals

Colour.name: Aluminium
Colour.examples: Surface coating (eg, for cake decoration or confectionary)

Colour.name: Silver
Colour.examples: May be used for silver surface coating

Colour.name: Gold
Colour.examples: May be used for gold surface coating

Colour.name: Lithol rubine BK
Colour.examples: Used for colouring cheese rind

Preservatives.name: Sorbic acid
description: Naturally occurring in some fruit but generally manufactured synthetically for use as a food preservative
Preservatives.examples: Commonly added to soft drinks, cheese spread, frozen pizza, and cakes

Preservatives.name: Benzoic acid
description: Occurs naturally in cherry bark, raspberries, tea, anise, and cassia bark, but largely prepared synthetically for commercial use
Preservatives.examples: Acts as a preservative and antioxidant most frequently in fruit products, soft drinks, pickled produce, and salad dressings

Preservatives.name: Sulfur dioxide
description: Gas prepared chemically for use as a food preservative, flour improver, bleaching agent, and Vitamin C stabiliser
Preservatives.examples: Found in carbonated drinks, marmalade, glace cherries, mixed peel, cakes, fruit based products, and meat products

Preservatives.name: Sodium sulphite
Preservatives.examples: May be used to prevent discolouration in dried fruit

Preservatives.name: Sodium hydrogen sulphite
Preservatives.examples: Often added to wine and beer

Preservatives.name: Sodium metabisulphite
Preservatives.examples: Added to sausages and some bottled sauces

Preservatives.name: Potassium metabisulphite
Preservatives.examples: Sometimes used to preserve beer, wine, and other fermented beverages

Preservatives.name: Calcium hydrogen sulphite
Preservatives.examples: May be used in canned fruit and beer products

Preservatives.name: Potassium hydrogen sulphite
Preservatives.examples: May be used in alcoholic beverages

Preservatives.name: Potassium nitrite
description: Naturally occurring mineral used as a preservative and colour fixative
Preservatives.examples: Used in cooked meats, sausages, and cured meats

Preservatives.name: Sodium nitrite
description: Derived from sodium nitrate by chemical or bacterial action
Acts as a preservative and colour fixative
Preservatives.examples: Acts as a preservative and colour fixative

Preservatives.name: Sodium nitrate
description: Naturally occurring mineral, usually manufactured synthetically for use as a food preservative and colour fixative
Preservatives.examples: In cooked meats, bacon, ham, and cheese

Preservatives.name: Potassium nitrate
description: Naturally occurring but more usually produced artificially from animal waste and vegetable material
One of the oldest and most effective preservatives for meat
Preservatives.examples: Found in cured and cooked meats, and sausages

Preservatives.name: Propionic acid
description: Fatty acid produced by animals in the process of digestion, but generally manufactured synthetically
Preservatives.examples: Added to baked goods, Functions as a preservative

Preservatives.name: Boric acid
Preservatives.examples: Sometimes used in meat, fish, and dairy products, Other uses include antiseptic and insecticide

Preservatives.name: Sodium tetraborate; borax
description: Sodium salt of boric acid (see E284)
Preservatives.examples: Sometimes used as caviar preservative, Banned in some countries including the United States

Preservatives.name: Lysozyme
description: Preservative, Natural enzyme found in tears, saliva, blood, sweat, and breast milk

Antioxidants.name: Curcumin
Antioxidants.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

Thickeners.name: Curcumin
Thickeners.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

pH regulators.name: Curcumin
pH regulators.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

Flavour enhancers.name: Curcumin
Flavour enhancers.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

Antibiotics.name: Curcumin
Antibiotics.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

sweeteners.name: Curcumin
sweeteners.examples: Used in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups
